bibl.title: Temples and Soldiers in Southern Ptolemaic Egypt. Some Epigraphic Evidence.
bibl.note: All the inscriptions mentioned by the author date from the reigns of Ptolemy VI or Ptolemy VIII. The gymnasion appears as a circle in its own right, alongside the temple and the army.

bibl.title: Politics, Administration and Society in the Hellenistic and Roman World. Proceedings of the International Colloquium, Bertinoro 19-24 July 1997

bibl.seg: DIETZE Gertrud, Temples and Soldiers in Southern Ptolemaic Egypt. Some Epigraphic Evidence.

Leon MOOREN (Ed.), Politics, Administration and Society in the Hellenistic and Roman World. Proceedings of the International Colloquium, Bertinoro 19-24 July 1997 = Studia Hellenistica. 36 (Leuven, 2000) pp. 77-89.
All the inscriptions mentioned by the author date from the reigns of Ptolemy VI or Ptolemy VIII. The gymnasion appears as a circle in its own right, alongside the temple and the army.
